intro: Psychotria capitata f. tomentosa, commonly known as the tomentose psychotria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage, which gives it a distinctive, soft appearance. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers, often arranged in umbels. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. This species is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and understorey habitats.
